meanings.definition: To claim too much or beyond what is reasonable.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overclaim credit for our group projects.
meanings.sent2: It is not wise to overclaim your abilities when applying for a job.
meanings.sent3: He always overclaims his dessert portion, hoping no one will notice.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to overclaim support from the community.
meanings.sent5: The student's attempt to overclaim his knowledge backfired during the exam.

meanings.sent1: The advertisement made an overclaim about the product's effectiveness.
meanings.sent2: The lawsuit was dismissed due to the plaintiff's overclaim of damages.
meanings.sent3: The overclaim of the treasure map's value led to a disappointing discovery.
meanings.sent4: Her overclaim of being a celebrity caused confusion at the event.
meanings.sent5: The overclaim of the company's success was quickly debunked by financial reports.
